sub_title: Researcher and solution architect remote patient management, designing and evaluating innovative tele-health solutions addressing the real needs of patients and healthcare providers.
summary:
At Philips Research (Eindhoven, Netherlands) I’m investigating and delivering high-quality innovative tele-health solutions. Philips Research is part of Philips, a global leader in health technology (77,000 employees world-wide, €18 bn turnover).

Collecting and translating unmet customer needs into effective solutions with a strong conceptual foundation is my passion. With tremendous perseverance, I:
-	discover unmet customer needs in a systematic way,
-	design innovative tele-health solutions, and
-	evaluate these solutions via clinical studies.

I’m at my best as cooperating leader of small multi-disciplinary teams, combining different perspectives and bridging the clinical world and technology. I have experience in cardiology (heart failure, myocardial infarction, arrhythmia), COPD, sleep, and diabetes, and am able to pick-up new domains very quickly.

In my current function, my recent activities include:
- identifying customer needs and innovation opportunities for the ambulatory ECG business
- designing a remote patient management system for diabetes type 2 patients
- designing and evaluating an application for home-based cardiac tele-rehabilitation

Details on these activities can be found in the Experience section.

profile_positions.description:
At Philips Research I'm responsible for collecting the needs of patients and healthcare providers, for translating these needs into innovative tele-health solutions, and for protecting these innovations with patents.

In my current function, my recent activities include:

Identifying customer needs and innovation opportunities for the ambulatory ECG business:
- designing on-line survey to identify vital signs offering added value for diagnosis of arrhythmias
- interviewing cardiologists and electrophysiologists on vital signs and unmet needs
- identifying innovation opportunities with Outcome Driven Innovation / Jobs-to-be-Done process
- presenting results of above activities to business unit; results are input to strategic roadmap
- Chief Medical Officer: “this is by far the best product insight I have seen over the last 4 years”

Designing a remote patient management system for diabetes type 2 patients:
- leading agile development team as scrum master
- translating clinical protocol with decision rules into software requirements
- giving application training to staff of remote medical service center at health insurer
- supporting patients having Bluetooth connectivity issues between third party devices
- in this clinical study with 74 patients the glucose level improved significantly

Designing and evaluating an application for home-based cardiac tele-rehabilitation:
- collecting requirements of patients and care providers in interviews with mock-ups
- leading a team with user interface designer, physiologist, psychologist, software engineers
- interviewing patients in Germany to collect feedback on application
- the patients in the USA rated the app usability as excellent (median SUS score 82.5)
- 82% of patients reported that the system helped them to achieve physical activity goals
